thread.title: This week's Apprentice tested candidates' French-speaking skills and it was all very awkward
thread.title_full: This week's Apprentice tested candidates' French-speaking skills and it was all very awkward

title: This week's Apprentice tested candidates' French-speaking skills and it was all very awkward
text:
This week's Apprentice tested candidates' French-speaking skills and it was all very awkward This week's Apprentice tested candidates' French-speaking skills and it was all very awkward 
— Bianca Miller (@Bianca_B_Miller) October 21, 2015 
The episode began with Joseph answering the phone and receiving instructions to head to Dover for this week’s task. Anyone who wears braces while also wearing pyjamas is not trustworthy to answer a phone correctly. Mark #TheApprentice 
— Sam & Mark (@samandmarktv) October 21, 2015 
Joseph and Vana put themselves forward to be project managers. Her accent makes her words so much sassier. #TheApprentice 
— Kirstie Saunders (@KirstieLouiseS) October 21, 2015 
And one of their first tests was to find out who could speak French within each group to make trading easier overseas. "I have an A Level""That's very good."😂😂😂😂 #TheApprentice 
— Frodo Swaggins (@hellyeh_) October 21, 2015 "Guys I can speak French, listen to this"*clears throat*"baguette" #TheApprentice 
The teams were given a list of items to buy and one of these, of course, was manure, which the teams dug up themselves. 
Some were less country-wise than others… 
— The Apprentice (@bbcapprentice) October 21, 2015 Don't know about you but I always shovel manure in my suede stilettos! #TheApprentice #BBCApprentice 
— Pauline Martin (@ChampagnePaulie) October 21, 2015 
They were also asked to buy a particular cheese, but unfortunately, the girls bought the wrong kind. Important life lesson: never skimp on cheese. Never. (Never) #TheApprentice 
— Rowan Coleman (@rowancoleman) October 21, 2015 THEY BOUGHT THE WRONG CHEESE ALAN #TheApprentice pic.twitter.com/zzRqXnuwsA 
As the episode went on, Vana’s attitude appeared to grate on Twitter users. Vana's attitude stinks #TheApprentice 
— James Flanagan (@JamesFl) October 21, 2015 Why is Katie Hopkins wearing a brunette wig and speaking in an American accent? #TheApprentice 
— Brian Butterfield (@MrBButterfield) October 21, 2015 When project manager thinks she's queen #theapprentice https://t.co/jHuqYe9eij 
— £transfinancal£ (@behlul_official) October 21, 2015 
But others appreciated her honesty. I love that Vanna is so honest and speaks her mind, calls people on their game-playing. I really hope it doesn't hurt her #TheApprentice 
— Roisin Hogan (@RoisinEHogan) October 21, 2015 
Ultimately, Jenny was sent packing after Vana dubbed her a “deadweight”. However, she didn’t go out without a fight, giving the longest ‘thank you’ speech in Apprentice history. Maybe. Longest ThankyoufortheoppourtunityLordSugar ever. #TheApprentice Nice speech there Jenny, changed my life #inspirational #TheApprentice Share article
